Chile.Title: Viña Maipo 2015 Vitral Chardonnay (Chile)
Chile.Description: Apple and citrus aromas are neither well defined nor overly aromatic. Fresh and juicy on the palate, this offers citrus peel and green melon flavors. Mild and short on the finish.

Chile.Title: Rios de Chile 2015 Chardonnay (Central Valley)
Chile.Description: Bland, fleshy aromas of corn and apple cider are unconvincing but not overtly negative. This feels plump and heavy, like fruit punch. Flavors of cantaloupe and citrus fruits finish yeasty, with notes of corn and white bread.

Chile.Title: Rios de Chile 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)
Chile.Description: Flat, dusty aromas of lees and vanilla cookies are rather lifeless. While this is wet and somewhat juicy in feel, it's bland as a whole, with yeasty melon and citrus flavors that finish bready.

Chile.Title: Albamar 2015 Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)
Chile.Description: Prickly, punchy, pryazinic aromas will have you thinking this is Sauvignon Blanc or Spanish Verdejo. A sharp palate is more about acid than body, while this continues with its SB-like character via green flavors of lime and arugula. A crisp finish evaporates into nothing.

Chile.Title: Indomita 2015 Gran Reserva Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)
Chile.Description: Heavy oak and marginal white-fruit scents make for a compromised nose. This feels chunky and resiny, with heavy flavors of clove and raw wood. Additional clove notes on the finish render this Chardonnay an underachiever.

Chile.Title: Santa Alicia 2015 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Maipo Valley)
Chile.Description: Underripe aromas of bell pepper and scallion correctly announce a shearing, high-acid palate. Salty, tart flavors of citrus fruits finish with pyrazine-driven green notes.

Spain.Title: Matarromera 2015 Fermentado en Barrica Verdejo (Rueda)
Spain.Description: Mellow white-fruit aromas are nonspecific and oaky, but not overly so. This barrel-fermented Verdejo feels plump and chunky, with balancing acidity. Salty melon, apricot and apple flavors end steady and long. For barrel-fermented Verdejo, this is at the top of the pile.

Spain.Title: Agustí Torelló Mata 2015 XIC Xarel-lo (Penedès)
Spain.Description: Dusty stone-fruit aromas suggest yeast and nectarine. This varietal Xarel-lo feels citrusy and spunky; flavors of melon, orange and nectarine are good but standard on the finish. Overall, this is linear and fairly basic for white wine.

Spain.Title: Ignacio Marín 2015 Wine Wings Garnacha Rosé (Cariñena)
Spain.Description: Crisp plum and red-bell-pepper aromas lead to a healthy, mostly fresh palate with some weight to it. A mix of citrus and red-plum flavors ends long, without much, if any, unwanted pithiness or bitterness.

Spain.Title: Baigorri 2015 Blanco Fermentado en Barrica Viura (Rioja)
Spain.Description: Waxy lightly toasted aromas of yellow apple are more subtle than popping. This barrel-fermented wine offers good weight and balance along with quiet flavors of spiced apple and vanilla. A sophisticated clean finish is lightly oaked in flavor and smooth in feel.

Spain.Title: Jean León 2015 3055 Chardonnay (Penedès)
Spain.Description: This wine's melon and mango aromas come with an oily note of lanolin. It feels lazy on the palate, with just enough acidity to maintain freshness. Mild tropical fruit flavors turn yeasty on its hollow finish. Drink immediately.

Spain.Title: Clos de Nit 2015 Red (Montsant)
Spain.Description: The tomato and plum aromas in this Garnacha blend are a bit soupy. Its chunky palate is heavy with generic berry fruit and a touch of oxidation. A solid, middle-of-the-road pour.

Spain.Title: Raventós de Alella 2015 Tina 20 Pansa Blanca (Alella)
Spain.Description: This varietal Xarello feels more flat than vivid. It has fleshy yet generic white fruit aromas, ripe melon flavors and a tired finish.

Spain.Title: Bodegas Riojanas 2015 Canchales Vino Joven  (Rioja)
Spain.Description: Rubbery raspberry and plum aromas are decent. This feels crisp and abrasive on the surface, but sort of empty in the middle. Lean snappy plum and raspberry flavors end with scratchy tannins and a medicinal aftertaste.

Spain.Title: Gorrebusto 2015  Rioja
Spain.Description: Candied berry aromas lack crispness. This feels hard, with little give and depth to the palate. Burnt toasted berry flavors are hot and fall off on a clumsy finish.

Spain.Title: Sonsierra 2015 Selección Tempranillo Rosé (Rioja)
Spain.Description: This pink wine smells of red-apple skins. The palate is low on acidity but not entirely dull. Dry briny lightly bitter flavors don't show a lot of fruit, while this is pulpy on the finish.

Spain.Title: Venta Morales 2015 Made With Organic Grapes Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Spain.Description: Heavy oak aromas sit atop wiry plum and spice scents. This feels tannic and tough, with up-front oak and herbal berry flavors. A dry tannic, spicy finish features palpable oak that tastes forced and like plastic.

Spain.Title: Bodegas Isidro Milagro 2015 SPÑ Red (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Spain.Description: Prickly berry aromas include notes of both candied raspberry and cinnamon. This feels a bit clunky and sticky, with sugary berry flavors and a slightly cloying finish.

Spain.Title: Lo Nuevo 2015 Covello Albariño (Rías Baixas)
Spain.Description: Lemon and apple aromas precede a high-acid citric palate without much elegance or finesse. This pedestrian Albariño deals pithy orange flavors that come with a note of grape skins. On the finish, this seems like orange juice.

Spain.Title: Ramón Bilbao 2015 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
Spain.Description: Apple and melon aromas are clean, stony and direct. This feels juicy while also offering ample body weight. Tangerine and nectarine flavors finish long, minerally and ripe, with none of Albariño's common pithy bitterness.

Spain.Title: Granbazán 2015 Etiqueta Ámbar Albariño (Rías Baixas)
Spain.Description: Dry, dusty, elegant peach and minerally notes open this excellent Albariño. The lightest bit of spritz gives edge and zest to a medium-full palate. Flavors of stone fruits, wild herbs, field greens and white pepper finish healthy, with a melony aftertaste.

Spain.Title: Fillaboa 2015 Estate Grown/Viñedo Propio Albariño (Rías Baixas)
Spain.Description: Fleshy oily aromas of orange peel and white flowers lead to a chunky, citric palate that's more full and blocky than elegant. Briny orange and tart nectarine flavors finish plump.

Spain.Title: Palma Real 2015 Verdejo-Viura (Rueda)
Spain.Description: Melon, nectarine and mild citrus aromas are clean and direct. This basic white is firm and balanced, while stone fruit, melon and white-pepper flavors end easy and fresh.

Spain.Title: Bodegas Carballal 2015 Floreano e Punto Albariño (Rías Baixas)
Spain.Description: Aromas of orange pulp and peel are hanging in there. This feels both oily and citric, while sour-leaning citrus flavors are a bit salty. On the finish, this feels plump and holds onto its citrusy essence. Drink immediately.

Spain.Title: El Coto 2015 Rosado (Rioja)
Spain.Description: Lightly pickled citrus aromas include a note of pyrazines. Direct on the palate, with a reasonably good mouthfeel, this delivers short flavors of stone fruits in front of a finish that's mildly pithy and bitter.

Hungary.Title: Samuel Tinon 2015 Megyer Dry Furmint (Tokaj)
Hungary.Description: From a vineyard in Northern Tokaj this dry Furmint has aromas of citrus pith and freshly cut pineapple. In the mouth, there are delightful flavors of grapefruit juice and white peach before the pleasantly acidic finish.

Hungary.Title: Chateau Dereszla 2015 Dry  (Tokaji)
Hungary.Description: This straw-colored wine made predominantely from Furmint has tropical aromas of passion fruit and mango and a touch of fresh white peach. White peach, yellow peach and guava flavors show on the palate before the zesty finish.

Greece.Title: Lyrarakis 2015 Vilana (Crete)
Greece.Description: This indigenous Cretan variety shows its character in the deft hands of Lyrarakis, grown at high altitude. Aromas of fresh pineapple, citrus and flowers lead into pear, green apple and saline notes. Balanced and bright.

Greece.Title: Kintonis 2015 M Malagousia (Peloponnese)
Greece.Description: Lemon zest, mango and flowers lead the nose on this elegant Malagousia. Smooth and silky with juicy orange and citrus flavors, the wine has an elegant overall character.

Greece.Title: Lyrarakis 2015 Vóila Vineyard Assyrtiko (Crete)
Greece.Description: Fresh lemon, sea salt and grapefruit aromas lead this buoyant pour from Crete. On the palate, appealing flavors of ripe lemon, tropical fruit and spice give it weight enough to pair with heartier dishes. That said, it finishes clean with a peppery finish.

Greece.Title: Estate Biblia Chora 2015 White (Pangeon)
Greece.Description: he nose on this Assyrtiko blend is feisty and spicy, followed a combination of tropical fruit, citrus and vanilla spice on the palate. The wine is fuller bodied but brisk on the finish. Appealing overall and a very nice week-day white.

Portugal.Title: Casca Wines 2015 Bote Chardonnay-Fernão Pires-Vital White (Lisboa)
Portugal.Description: Heading nicely in the crisp and aromatic direction, this is a light and bright wine. It has a citrus flavor that is balanced by richer pear and plum fruits. The wine is ready to drink.

Portugal.Title: Cortes de Cima 2015 Rosé (Alentejano)
Portugal.Description: Onion skin orange in color, this is a full and fat wine. It has attractive red-berry fruit and just the right amount of acidity to keep it fresh and crisp. Drink now.

Portugal.Title: Messias 2015 Santola White (Vinho Verde)
Portugal.Description: In a medium sweet style, the wine has a light prickle and fine citrus acidity to balance the soft freshness. It is a refreshing wine, totally drinkable immediately.

Portugal.Title: Quinta de Paços 2015 Casa de Paços Rosé (Vinho Verde)
Portugal.Description: A rose pink colored wine that is dry and with ripe fruit. Its acidity contrasts with the warm red-berry fruit and the edge of tannin. There is a peppery, crisp aftertaste.

Portugal.Title: Herdade Grande 2015 Audaz Branco White (Alentejano)
Portugal.Description: The wine is ripe with apple and creamed pear flavors. It is warm, rich and missing acidity. There is an attractive almond and spice character to this ripe wine. Drink now.

Portugal.Title: Wines & Winemakers 2015 Casa Ermelinda Freitas Monte de Baía Rosé (Península de Setúbal)
Portugal.Description: This raspberry-flavored wine is soft and ripe. While it is fruity, it also has a nutty character that gives it a rich taste. It's dry and in a style that will make it better with food than by itself.

Portugal.Title: Ribafreixo 2015 Pato Frio Antão Vaz (Alentejo)
Portugal.Description: The grape is local to the Vidigueira region of the southern Alentejo. Coming from cool vineyards, the wine has a fresh character that is balanced by the ripe melon and juicy pear fruits. It has a crisper end and is ready to drink.

Portugal.Title: Falua 2015 Conde Vimioso Colheita Seleccionada Branco White (Tejo)
Portugal.Description: A blend of Fernão Pires and Arinto, this is totally crisp and refreshingly fruity. It is perfumed, smooth while also cut with acidity. The acidity comes from both citrus and pineapple flavors. Drink now.

Portugal.Title: Fiuza 2015 Red (Tejo)
Portugal.Description: Known in Spain as Graciano, this grape produces attractive, fruity wine especially in the Tejo region. This example is ripe with layers of acidity as well as a generous texture. Soft and smooth, it is ready to drink.

Portugal.Title: Sandeman 2015 Quinta do Seixo Vintage  (Port)
Portugal.Description: Ripe and fruity, this is already delicious, but that doesn't detract from the firm tannins and density of a wine that will age well. It has all the elements, with the fruit, solid tannins and a juicy aftertaste. Drink from 2025.

Portugal.Title: Quinta do Vesuvio 2015 Vintage  (Port)
Portugal.Description: Full of ripe fruit, this wine is rich while also having a delicately perfumed character. With its spice, generous fruits and sense of poise, it will age well. Drink from 2027.

Portugal.Title: Churchill's 2015 Quinta da Gricha Vintage  (Port)
Portugal.Description: Ripe, fruity and balanced, this has the potential to be a delicious, not-too-concentrated wine. Acidity and some dry tannins give the wine a firm character that is balanced by the fragrant berry fruits. Drink from 2026.

Portugal.Title: Wines & Winemakers 2015 Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas Rosé (Douro)
Portugal.Description: Made from old vines, this rich rosé is full of fruit. It has fine acidity as well as wild-strawberry flavors. The texture, lightly mineral, gives the wine a crisp, tight shape. With a fresh aftertaste, the wine will be just right for food.

Portugal.Title: Casca Wines 2015 Cascas Winemaker Selection Red (Lisboa)
Portugal.Description: Syrah, Castelão and Aragonez go into the blend of this rich juicy wine. It is so soft and ripe, just hinting at tannins and with red-berry fruit. The wine is round and smooth, ready to drink.

Portugal.Title: Magnum Vinhos 2015 Flor de Maio Mayflower Red (Alentejano)
Portugal.Description: Named after the poppy that blooms in May in the Alentejo, this wine is juicy and fruity, with a light touch of tannins. It is all red berries, with an easygoing juicy character, Drink now.

Portugal.Title: Fiuza 2015 Tinta Miúda Red (Tejo)
Portugal.Description: Tinta Miúda, known as the rare Graciano grape in Spain, is not often found in Portugal. Here it makes a ripe, juicy and jammy wine that's soft, with only a minimum of tannins to keep it together. It has a typically warm character and is ready to drink.

Portugal.Title: Adega Mãe 2015 Pinta Negra Rosé (Lisboa)
Portugal.Description: Lisboa, with its cool climate, lends itself to crisp rosés like this. This lively fruity wine is touched by hints of vanilla and layers of red-fruit flavors. It is light and ready to drink.

Portugal.Title: Parras Wines 2015 Mula Velha Reserva Red (Lisboa)
Portugal.Description: Mula Velha, “the old donkey,” is a younger wine than its name suggests. Brisk and fruity, it offers firm tannins and layers of blackberry fruit. With a touch of oak aging, the wine is developing well and will be ready to drink from late 2017.

Portugal.Title: Parras Wines 2015 Terra Grande Red (Alentejano)
Portugal.Description: This wine is ripe, full of black fruits and soft tannins. With plenty of acidity to keep it crisp, the wine has a cool, flavorful character topped off by berry fruits. It's ready to drink.

Portugal.Title: Quinta dos Avidagos 2015 Lote 138 Red (Douro)
Portugal.Description: This wine is light in tannins and ripe in fruit, with a delicious red-berry character. Drink this attractive wine from 2019.

Portugal.Title: J. Portugal Ramos 2015 Pouca Roupa Branco White (Alentejano)
Portugal.Description: This wine is smooth and soft, with an attractive creamy texture and light acidity. Yellow fruits and stewed pears are lifted by a mineral texture. The wine is named after the vineyard rather than after the literal Portuguese meaning of “scantily dressed.” Drink now.

Portugal.Title: Adega Mãe 2015 Pinta Negra Tinto Red (Lisboa)
Portugal.Description: This wine is ripe with red fruits and soft tannins. It is smooth, packed with red-berry flavors lifted by the acidity. Made to be drunk young, it is ready now.

Portugal.Title: Casa Santos Lima 2015 Fortissimo Red (Alentejano)
Portugal.Description: Smooth red-berry fruits give this wine a glow of ripeness. The blend of Touriga Nacional, Syrah and Alicante Bouschet is dense and full of dark berries, with a touch of wood aging to smooth everything out. Drink now.

Portugal.Title: Quinta da Ribeirinha 2015 Ardósia Tinto Red (Tejo)
Portugal.Description: Made to drink young, this fruity, softly structured wine is ripe with blackberry fruits. There is a touch of spice from the wood aging and a lining of attractive acidity. Drink now.

Portugal.Title: Quinta de Porrais 2015 Porrais Red (Douro)
Portugal.Description: The quinta for this wine is on the plateau north of the Douro river. It has produced a red-fruit wine, rich with soft tannins and juicy fruitiness. The wood aging is already well integrated into this bold, ripe wine. Drink now.

Portugal.Title: Quinta do Vale Meão 2015 Vintage  (Port)
Portugal.Description: This wine is light in body but heavily perfumed. Clean fruit shows on the palate, with an addition of geranium aromas.

Portugal.Title: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2015 Beyra Colheita Red (Beira Interior)
Portugal.Description: This simple, open and fruity wine has gentle tannins. It is all about ripe berries and acidity. Made to be drunk young for its fruitiness, it is ready now.

Portugal.Title: Quinta do Casal Monteiro 2015 White (Tejo)
Portugal.Description: A young, fresh blend of Arinto and Fernão Pires, the wine is fruity, light and with a crisp, bright aftertaste. Drink now.

Portugal.Title: Magnum Vinhos 2015 Ribeiro Santo Red (Dão)
Portugal.Description: The perfumes of Touriga Nacional dominate this soft, smooth wine. A layer of tannins gives structure, and the ripeness of the fruit creates a delicious, full-bodied wine.

Argentina.Title: Domaine Bousquet 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Tupungato)
Argentina.Description: Saucy berry and tea aromas are herbal, earthy and stewed. This feels full but syrupy. Flavors of cooked berry, molasses and mocha finish sweet and soupy, with only a touch of acidic offset.

Argentina.Title: Mendel 2015 Semillon (Mendoza)
Argentina.Description: Mushy citrus and papaya aromas are waxy and lack pop. Angular and lemony in feel, this varietal white offers a one-note flavor profile based on lemon. A ringing, citric finish affords for a hint of tropical fruit.

Argentina.Title: Terrazas de Los Andes 2015 Reserva Torrontés (Salta)
Argentina.Description: Initial aromas of lychee and jasmine are varietally correct but this struggles to stay fresh and instead turns oily on the nose. A mid-level palate holds nectarine, lychee and oily flavors that turn bitter on the finish.

Argentina.Title: El Esteco 2015 Don David Reserve Torrontés (Calchaquí Valley)
Argentina.Description: Oily, gritty aromas of almond skins set up a pungent but oily tasting palate. Core fruit flavors lean towards sour grapefruit and orange, while the finish is tangy, salty and sour through the last note.

Argentina.Title: Viña Cobos 2015 Bramare Marchiori Vineyard Chardonnay (Perdriel)
Argentina.Description: Oaky, smoky aromas are New World all the way. Heavily toasted and creamy on the palate, this hefty full-bodied Chardonnay tastes of wood resin, spiced apple and peach. Solid acidity keep this in line, while a lasting wave of toasty oak pushes the finish.

Argentina.Title: Domaine Bousquet 2015 Reserve Pinot Gris (Tupungato)
Argentina.Description: Despite looking gold and mature, this PG exceeds expectations courtesy of waxy, baked-apple aromas and a full but balanced mouthfeel. Spiced apple, apricot and burnt orange flavors finish long due to core acidity. Drink immediately.

Argentina.Title: Finca Sophenia 2015 Altosur Sauvignon Blanc (Tupungato)
Argentina.Description: Aromas of citrus and petrol are backed by a juicy palate with tangy acidity and semisharp flavors of peach, tangerine and stone-fruit pits. Fresh, citrusy length and a lingering note of orange are the finish.

Argentina.Title: Finca Lalande 2015 Malbec (Mendoza)
Argentina.Description: Olive, saucy berry and a sense of rawness on the nose drive this Malbec towards a solid but slightly scratchy feeling palate. Plum, blackberry and minty oak flavors are short and lightly herbal, while this ends without much force.

Argentina.Title: Aymara 2015 Estate Torrontés (Maipú)
Argentina.Description: Flat aromas of lanolin and oily white fruits lead to a round, full palate that's getting tired. Salty nectarine and flowery flavors finish with a yeasty note of ham and white fruits.

Argentina.Title: Valentin Bianchi 2015 Sensual Malbec (Mendoza)
Argentina.Description: Lightly spicy raspberry aromas are raw and peppery. This feels fleshy and pulpy, with punchy acidity. Peppery berry flavors are boosted by toasty oak that carries over to a mildly hot finish.

Argentina.Title: Benvenuto de la Serna 2015 Mil Piedras Viognier (Vista Flores)
Argentina.Description: Lime and tangerine aromas are light and dusty, with a yeasty note. This feels mostly sound but basic, with leesy, melony flavors. On the finish, this loses intensity and turns bready in flavor and soft in feel.

Argentina.Title: Aniello 2015 006 Riverside Estate Merlot (Patagonia)
Argentina.Description: Dry earthy herbal aromas of tomato, red-berry fruits and oak set up a full palate with pounding tannins. This tastes roasted and herbal, with notes of bell pepper, tomato and creamy oak. A hard-tannin finish confirms that this Merlot skipped charm school.

Argentina.Title: Amalaya 2015 Esperanza Por Un Milagro White (Salta)
Argentina.Description: Oily aromas of citrus peel and lychee set up a lemony palate with pyrazine-influenced citrus flavors. Lychee is the lead flavor on a finish that's mildly bitter.

Argentina.Title: François Lurton 2015 Piedra Negra Pinot Gris Alta Colección Rosado (Uco Valley)
Argentina.Description: Salmon-colored and spritzy, this rosé of Pinot Grigio smells stony and peachy. A zesty palate has sizzle and zest to it, while stone-fruit and minerally flavors are salty prior to a mildly bitter finish that tastes of pithy citrus.

Argentina.Title: Casa Montes 2015 Ampakama Viognier (San Juan)
Argentina.Description: Briny, cidery aromas are a touch stale. This has a basic citrusy mouthfeel along with flavors of orange and tangerine that turn mildly bitter and pithy on the finish.

Argentina.Title: Viña Cobos 2015 Felino Malbec (Mendoza)
Argentina.Description: Earthy black-fruit aromas set up a rubbery, heavy palate with plenty of oak and related resin. This tastes mostly of oak and clove, with savory blackberry notes resting at the base. A solid salty choppy finish shows a tight grip and moderate roughness.

Argentina.Title: Zolo 2015 Sustainably Farmed Estate Grown and Bottled Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)
Argentina.Description: Cola, plum and red-currant aromas set up a tight palate with clamping tannins. Flavors of black cherry, cassis, plum and chocolate are lasting across the finish. This needs hearty food, additional airing or both to show its best.

Australia.Title: Jacob's Creek 2015 Classic Pinot Grigio (South Eastern Australia)
Australia.Description: Melon and citrus aromas and flavors mingle easily in this cleanly made quaffer. It's a bit plump on the palate, yet refreshing on the lemon-lime finish.

Australia.Title: Ben Haines 2015 B Minor Marsanne-Roussanne (Goulburn Valley)
Australia.Description: At less than 13% abv, this is on the lighter side of the Rhône white spectrum, offering simple pear and toasted marshmallow aromas and flavors that finish lean and crisp.

Australia.Title: Xanadu 2015 Exmoor Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Margaret River)
Australia.Description: This shows some pungent, boxwood-like scents up front, followed by modest passion fruit and a bit of citrus, falling away on the finish. Drink now.

Australia.Title: Wirra Wirra 2015 Scrubby Rise White (Adelaide)
Australia.Description: An innovative blend of Sauvignon Blanc (53%), Semillon (37%) and Viognier (10%), this medium-bodied wine delivers a mix of figs and melons, underscored by a silky texture. Ready to drink.

Australia.Title: Riposte 2015 The Dagger Pinot Noir (Adelaide Hills)
Australia.Description: Pretty aromas of cherry and plum blossoms give way to fully ripe, slightly confectionary fruit, backed by hints of mocha. This medium-bodied Pinot Noir is supple in texture and softly dusty on the finish, making it an easy one to drink over the next couple of years.

New Zealand.Title: Carrick 2015 Bannockburn Chardonnay (Central Otago)
New Zealand.Description: This plump, medium-bodied Chardonnay shows yellow fruit notes of mirabelle plum, peach and pineapple, all wrapped in a cocoon of woodsmoke. Drink now–2020.

New Zealand.Title: Ten Sisters 2015 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)
New Zealand.Description: This medium-bodied wine features a heavy dose of baking spices and vanilla layered atop notions of earth and red cherries. It's a little dry and woody, but cinnamon and clove notes add charm.

New Zealand.Title: Dashwood 2015 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)
New Zealand.Description: This wine's aromas are marked by bright cherries and an undercurrent of button mushrooms. It's medium bodied and crisp, with just enough silky-textured tannin to give it some grip. Drink now.

New Zealand.Title: Brancott 2015 Pinot Grigio (Marlborough)
New Zealand.Description: Made in a frankly commercial, off-dry style, this is dangerously quaffable. Pronounced apple, pear and melon flavors are balanced by moderate acidity and a hint of ginger on the finish. Drink now.

Romania.Title: Jidvei 2015 Nec Plus Ultra Demisec Sauvignon Blanc (Jidvei)
Romania.Description: This wine is light straw-colored, with aromas of lemon blossom, lemongrass and freshly cut lawn. Flavors of peach, passion fruit and melon finish with a touch of residual sweetness.

Romania.Title: Cramele Recas 2015 Dreambird Merlot (Romania)
Romania.Description: Aromas of black berry and black cherry lead to flavors of cherry vanilla and red plum before a soft tannic finish.

Australia.Title: Yalumba 2016 Made With Organic Grapes Chardonnay (South Australia)
Australia.Description: This medium-bodied Chardonnay features aromas of pineapple and roasted cashew. Similar notes of ripe pineapple and nuts mark the palate, then ease to a rather soft, easy finish. Drink now.

Australia.Title: Mitolo 2016 Jester Sangiovese Rosé (McLaren Vale)
Australia.Description: Pale copper in hue, this wine exudes passion fruit on the nose, while the palate delivers nuances of muskmelon as well. It's crisp, racy and medium in body, perfectly suited to summertime refreshment. Drink now.

Australia.Title: Jacob's Creek 2016 Chardonnay (Australia)
Australia.Description: Tightly constructed for an entry-priced Chardonnay, this has faint almond nuttiness accenting pineapple and grapefruit flavors. Drink this medium-bodied wine through mid-2018.

France.Title: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2016 La Réserve Petit Manseng (Vin de France)
France.Description: This fruity, sweet wine is immediately attractive and ripe. With its great apricot and pineapple fruit, hints of spicy wood and balancing acidity, it's perfect as an apéritif—light and refreshing. Drink now.

France.Title: Château de Campuget 2016 Tradition Rosé (Costières de Nîmes)
France.Description: This bend of 70% Syrah and 30% Grenache is nevertheless very pale in hue. the nose hints at wet stone, thyme and bay leaf, while the medium-bodied palate delivers a harmonious blend of red berries and citrus. Long on the finish, with mouthwatering persistence.

France.Title: Domaine Clos Gautier 2016 Oser Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
France.Description: This blend of Cinsault, Grenache and Syrah is attractively fruity. It has a crisp texture that gives it a bright character, red-currant fruitiness and intense refreshing acidity. The aftertaste is elegant and fruity. The wine's name (meaning to dare) is an anagram of Rosé. Drink now.

France.Title: Domaine Harmonie des Arpents 2016 Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)
France.Description: This is a ripe, full and fruity wine. It is packed with attractive red-berry fruits and a crisp dry backbone. The acidity and the bright aftertaste make it a fine food rosé. It comes from a small appellation surrounded by the large Côtes de Provence area.

France.Title: Domaine Sainte-Marie 2016 Paparazzi Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
France.Description: Produced from organic grapes, the wine is ripe and packed with fruit. It has a delicious line of acidity, as well as weight and peach and red-fruit flavors. The acidity keeps the exuberance in check. Drink now.

France.Title: Château de la Vieille Tour 2016  Bordeaux Blanc
France.Description: In the Boissonneau family since 1839, this southern Entre-Deux-Mers vineyard gives a crisp, herbal wine with light fruit and attractive acidity. It has lemon and grapefruit flavors, bright with a crisp aftertaste. Drink now.

France.Title: Château la France 2016  Bordeaux Blanc
France.Description: The Mottet family bought this chateau in 2009 and has been in renovation mode: chateau, winery, vast vineyards and placement of a dramatic 40-foot steel rooster in the vineyard. This wine is refreshing, lively and crisp, with plenty of acidity. It reveals spice, apples and lime flavors along with a more mineral side. The wine is ready to drink.

France.Title: Château Lauduc 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)
France.Description: Light and fruity, this is a crisp wine with good acidity. a tangy character and a yeasty edge. Drink now.

France.Title: Gabriel Meffre 2016 La Châsse Chardonnay (Vin de France)
France.Description: Soft and fruity, this is an easy-to-drink wine. Its creamy texture and balanced acidity complement its apple flavors. It's ready to drink.

France.Title: Paul Buisse 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)
France.Description: This is a light bright wine, full of forward fruitiness. The tangy edge of minerality gives the wine a pleasing texture. Citrus fruits support this texture with their zest and acidity. The wine is ready to drink.

France.Title: Saget la Perrière 2016 La Petite Perrière Pinot Noir (Vin de France)
France.Description: This light, cool-climate Pinot Noir is crisp with red currant fruit and herbal-tinged acidity. It has a zesty character that keeps it lively and tight. Drink now.

France.Title: Vinadeis 2016 Le Val Merlot (Vin de France)
France.Description: The sunshine of the Languedoc comes through in this wine's warm, soft fruit. A touch of acidity and a backdrop of tannins give it contrast and a fine, ready-to-drink character.

France.Title: Domaine Girard 2016 Benoît Girard  (Sancerre)
France.Description: This has a soft texture that just allows room for some crisp apple flavors. Otherwise, it is a smooth rounded wine. Its fruitiness and its acidity are part and parcel of this ripe wine. Drink now.

France.Title: Domaine les Hautes Noëlles 2016 Les Parcelles Sur Lie  (Muscadet Côtes de Grandlieu)
France.Description: This is all light fruit and crisp acidity. Bright and light, brimming with citrus and apples, the wine is ready to drink. It comes from the western end of the Muscadet vineyards near the Lac de Grand-Lieu.

France.Title: Vinadeis 2016 Le Val Chardonnay (Vin de France)
France.Description: Consistently the top showing wine from the Le Val range, this is ripe and rounded, with a creamy texture and a toasty, spicy touch from light wood aging. Drink now.

France.Title: L. Tramier & Fils 2016 Tramier Chardonnay (Vin de France)
France.Description: Based in Burgundy, this producer understands Chardonnay. That's why this wine is so finely balanced, with a ripe and perfumed character and a warm, full aftertaste. Drink now.

US.Title: Palencia 2016 Albariño (Ancient Lakes)
US.Description: Vibrant aromas of ripe pear, white flowers and melon are followed by a just off-dry palate, with lean fruit flavors.

US.Title: Chateau Lafayette Reneau 2016 Pinot Noir Rosé (Finger Lakes)
US.Description: Ripe luscious black-cherry and berry notes lend heft to this bold concentrated rosé. It's just a shade off dry, but balances neatly, juxtaposing crisp acidity against lavish texture and a pleasantly clingy finish.

US.Title: Cupcake 2016 Rosé (California)
US.Description: This refreshing, well-structured wine offers vivid but light fruit flavors, a crisp balance and mouthwatering texture. It has lots of fresh citrus flavors that will pair well with salty meats and all kinds of seafood.

US.Title: Raconteur 2016 White (Washington)
US.Description: Two-thirds Chenin Blanc and one-third Grüner Veltliner, this wine opens with aromas of apple, white pepper, herb and spice. It brings a sense of freshness and purity, along with a rounded feel.

US.Title: Savage Grace 2016 Orange Oak Ridge Vineyard Gewürztraminer (Columbia Gorge (WA))
US.Description: This one-of-a-kind in the state wine was fermented on skins for 12 days, giving it a light-orange color. The aromas leap up from the glass, with notes of spice, lychee, orange peel and mineral. The palate is dry and textured, with a rich but still sleek feel. Put it on the dinner table to see it shine.

US.Title: Stevens 2016 StevensSteel Chardonnay (Yakima Valley)
US.Description: This is an expressive example of this variety, especially considering the stainless steel aging. The aromas are bright, with notes of apple, pear and melon. The cantaloupe flavors are broad and fleshy, lingering on the finish. It brings a lot of appeal.

US.Title: Vintage Cowboy 2016 Chardonnay (Paso Robles)
US.Description: Sweet honeysuckle, lime blossoms and honeydew show on the very flowery nose of this bottling from a newer property near the old mining town of Pozo. The sip tightens up smartly with Anjou pear and honeysuckle flavors, but it's the powerful acidity that makes for a compelling palate.

US.Title: Trisaetum 2016 Ribbon Ridge Estate Riesling (Ribbon Ridge)
US.Description: As characterful as the dry version but with lower alcohol and a slight hint of sweetness, this boasts powerful tangerine, quince and Meyer lemon fruit. Its electric acidity keeps it vivid and beautifully balanced. Delicious now, it's also cellar-worthy.

US.Title: Trisaetum 2016 Wichmann Dundee Estate Riesling (Dundee Hills)
US.Description: More tart than sweet, this delicious wine is packed with lemon drop, candied pineapple and tangerine fruit. The acidity is in perfect proportion with the slightly sweet palate, giving it a vivid mouthfeel that extends into the finish and offers versatility for food pairing.

US.Title: Trisaetum 2016 Coast Range Dry Riesling
US.Description: All Trisaetum's dry Rieslings feel a notch riper in this warm year, to good effect. Meticulous blending of individual lots, some aged in oak, brings layers of complexity and helps differentiate each cuvée. Concentrated pear, peach and papaya flavors are on display here, with tangy acidity and superb length and richness. It's dry, to be sure, but also brilliantly fruity.

US.Title: Aesthete 2016 Dry Stack Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Bennett Valley)
US.Description: Complex and composed, this vineyard-designate wine is brightly decorated in flavors of grapefruit pith and lemon zest, with zippy acidity. As it develops in the glass, richer elements of peach and apricot flesh out the palate with succulent aplomb.

US.Title: Damiani 2016 Dry Rosé (Finger Lakes)
US.Description: Deep penetrating sour-cherry and raspberry flavors are balanced against brisk blood-orange acidity in this dry Pinot Noir rosé. Full bodied and slightly silky on the palate, it's a satisfyingly mouthfilling but invigorating wine to enjoy now through the fall months.

US.Title: Cellars 33 2016 Rosé (California)
US.Description: This wine's light, sugary, red cherry and watermelon aromas lead to similar flavors and a light, lean texture. It has a bright coral color that's eye-catching.

US.Title: Keuka Spring 2016 Humphrey's Vineyard Riesling (Finger Lakes)
US.Description: Crushed stones and river rocks take center stage in this elegant off-dry Riesling. It's gorgeously mineral, yet also anchored against a backdrop of crisp cutting yellow-peach, tangerine and lemon flavors. It's a zesty, invigorating wine with a clean but persistent finish.

US.Title: Keuka Spring 2016 Semi Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)
US.Description: Peach and blossom notes abound on this delightfully fresh fruity wine. Its sunny stone-fruit flavors are concentrated and juicy, balanced against zesty lime acidity and a meandering pollen finish. Sprightly in texture yet buoyant.

US.Title: Kokomo 2016 Pauline's Vineyard Grenache Rosé (Dry Creek Valley)
US.Description: Strawberry and watermelon highlight a light, creamy palate of vanilla and lemon peel, the freshness maintained by moderate acidity.

US.Title: Matthews 2016 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))
US.Description: This 100% varietal wine brings lightly styled aromas of green grass, herb, snap pea and whiffs of green pepper. The palate is full bodied and textured, bringing a sense of richness but never losing its balance. It lingers on the finish.

US.Title: Paraduxx 2016 Rosé (Napa Valley)
US.Description: Pretty pink in color, this wine is inviting in aromatics, offering a depth of fresh strawberry and watermelon atop a substantial mouthfeel of body and weight. It finishes balanced and dry.

US.Title: Osprey's Dominion 2016 Dry Rosé (North Fork of Long Island)
US.Description: A touch of Riesling accentuates the fresh citrusy backbone on this Cabernet Sauvignon rosé. Dry in style with a sprightly light-footed tone, it offers loads of concentrated cherry and berry flavors. The finish is brisk and clean.

US.Title: Syncline 2016 McKinley Springs Vineyard Rosé (Horse Heaven Hills)
US.Description: This wine is a unique in the state blend and features Cinsault (35%), Grenache (35%) and Mourvèdre. Pale peach in color with a slight bronze tinge, the aromas are light, with notes of strawberry, citrus zest and mineral. The flavors are dry, sleek and high acid. It's a perfect summer wine.

Austria.Title: Steininger 2016 Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)
Austria.Description: That herbal, yeasty tang of Grüner is on display on the nose. The dry palate further brings out the earthy aspect with miso, stone, yeast and lemon. The body is light and balanced with a savory but diffuse finish.

Austria.Title: Strauss 2016 Classic Pinot Blanc (Steiermark)
Austria.Description: Although a flinty touch of reduction still hangs on the nose, freshness and verve await underneath. The palate is juicy, slight, dry and very refreshing. It offers a slender, lemony expression of Pinot Blanc with a clean-cut finish.

Austria.Title: Strauss 2016 Classic Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)
Austria.Description: Notes of tart lemon peel appear on the nose. The lean and light body continues in that lemony vein with brisk freshness. This wine is light, with a slight texture made up of yeastiness and zesty lemon. Some notes of grass appear on the finish. Drink this light, dry wine soon.

Austria.Title: Winzer Krems 2016 GV Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)
Austria.Description: Almost luscious pear aromas and notes of peardrop make for a very fruity nose. The palate has a fruity, lemony ease, while the body is slender, dry and has some spritz. The lemon freshness is vivid, brightening everything on this easy, fruity summer wine.

Austria.Title: Landhaus Mayer 2016 Riesling (Niederösterreich)
Austria.Description: A hint of tropicality hovers above the nose, recalling passion fruit. The palate restricts itself to fresh lemon and green apple. This is light, dry, juicy and refreshing—ideal for a sunny day as a light apéritif.

Austria.Title: Malat 2016 Furth-Palt Riesling (Kremstal)
Austria.Description: A touch of funky yeastiness plays on the nose before the lemon zestiness shines through. The palate is slender and light, focusing on that bright, fresh lemon note. This is easy, juicy and very refreshing.

Austria.Title: Zahel 2016 White (Wiener Gemischter Satz)
Austria.Description: Slight reduction still obstructs this wine's nose. The palate, however, is both zingy and rich—spiked with citrus and rounded with ripe, mellow apple fruit. There is verve and life at its core and tone to its medium body. The dry finish is appetizing.

Austria.Title: Allram 2016 Strassertaler Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)
Austria.Description: Freshly cut pear, ivy leaf and spice mark the nose of this wine. The palate is slender but juicy, full of citrus-fresh fruit. It's all about joy and drinkability, feeling more structured and serious on the clean finish.

Austria.Title: Domäne Wachau 2016 Terrassen Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)
Austria.Description: Fresh Conference pear notes abound on the nose of this wine. The palate is sprightly and fresh, with a zestier core of lime and pear peel. Slender in frame, it dances on the palate, displaying seriousness and levity at the same time. The finish is totally refreshing.

Austria.Title: Malat 2016 Ried am Zaum Hefeabzug Pinot Blanc (Wachau)
Austria.Description: The restrained nose just gives a glimpse of lemon freshness. Lemon notes intensify on the palate, where they attain a lovely textural feel of pith and zest. A slender wine, it still carries a hint of yeast on the midpalate, but is subtle, clean, slender and fine. The finish is dry and refreshing.

Austria.Title: Pratsch 2016 Ried Kittel Sauvignon Blanc (Niederösterreich)
Austria.Description: Soft notes of green bell pepper, nettle and grass give this a fresh aspect. The slender palate then adds lemon, giving a focused zestiness, with glimpses of boxwood. The wine is citric, slender and very refreshing.

Portugal.Title: Quinta da Foz 2016 Reserva Red (Douro)
Portugal.Description: Old vines, many up to 80-years-old, supply the grapes that were fermented in traditional granite lagars for a ripe jammy character in this powerful wine. It has solid tannins and great acidity, both of which will allow the wine to age. Drink this impressive wine from 2020.

Portugal.Title: Herdade do Esporão 2016 Defesa Branco White (Alentejano)
Portugal.Description: There is an attractive spiciness to this clean warm wine. White currants and acidity add to the approachability of a wine that is ready to drink.

Portugal.Title: J. Portugal Ramos 2016 Pouca Roupa Rosé (Alentejano)
Portugal.Description: This is a really refreshing style of rosé. Its fruity raspberry and red-currant flavors are shot through with fine acidity and a lively crisp aftertaste. Drink this attractive wine now.

Portugal.Title: DFJ Vinhos 2016 Bigode Rosé (Lisboa)
Portugal.Description: This is a crisp, clean and refreshing wine. There is just the lightest sense of tannin giving the wine a zingy edge. Other than that, it is red-berry fruits all the way. Drink now.

Portugal.Title: DFJ Vinhos 2016 Casa do Lago Branco White (Lisboa)
Portugal.Description: This is a delicious and ripe-fruited wine. Dominated by Fernão Pires, it has an apple-puree texture: smooth and creamy. The wine has an edge of light acidity at the end to give it a lift. Drink now.

Portugal.Title: Sanguinhal 2016 Cerejeiras Tinto Red (Lisboa)
Portugal.Description: This simple and fruity wine is made to be drunk young. And with its red fruits, light acidity and crisp texture, it succeeds. Drink the wine with summer barbecues.

Portugal.Title: Wines & Winemakers 2016 Casa Ermelinda Freitas Monte da Baía Branco White (Península de Setúbal)
Portugal.Description: The blend of Fernão Pires and Arinto is a classic for the region. It gives a light and perfumed wine with a creamy texture and plenty of balancing acidity. Bright and fruity, the wine has just a final tang to add crispness. Drink now.

Portugal.Title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2016 Cuvée B Red (Alentejo)
Portugal.Description: This is an open and ready-to-drink wine that has soft tannins and juicy blackberry fruit. With 50% Aragonez in the blend, it is has a smooth character that brings out plenty fruit and not too much structure. Drink now.

Portugal.Title: Quinta das Arcas 2016 Arca Nova Branco White (Vinho Verde)
Portugal.Description: This is a soft wine with its creamy fruits assimilated into the tangy texture. There is plenty of acidity to give this wine its cool character as well as its citrus and green-apple flavors. Drink now.

Portugal.Title: Wines & Winemakers 2016 Samora Rosé (Tejo)
Portugal.Description: A light, crisp blend of Merlot and Syrah, this is soft and gently fruity. Raspberry and red-currant flavors shine easily through this simple wine.

Portugal.Title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2016 Adega de Borba Branco White (Alentejo)
Portugal.Description: Crisp, bright and fruity, this is a refreshing and ripe wine. With attractive citrus acidity and a bright aftertaste, the wine is ready to drink.

Portugal.Title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2016 Brado Branco White (Alentejano)
Portugal.Description: The very local Tamarez grapes make an appearance in this lemon-colored and flavored wine. It is fruity, soft and bright with acidity. Drink now.

Portugal.Title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2016 Brado Red (Alentejano)
Portugal.Description: Young and fruity, this is a bright and wine for immediate drinking. It has hints of tannins, plenty of red fruits and no wood.

Portugal.Title: Casa de Vilacetinho 2016 Avesso & Azal White (Vinho Verde)
Portugal.Description: This is the lightest in a series of wines featuring the Avesso grape. Herbal, crisp and with plenty of acidity, it's also fruity and ready to drink.

Portugal.Title: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo 2016 Rosé (Douro)
Portugal.Description: This full-bodied wine conveys Douro warmth. A light touch of tannin gives it shape. Pepper and red-berry fruits complete a generous wine that will be best with food. Drink now.

Portugal.Title: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2016 Castello d'Alba Branco White (Douro)
Portugal.Description: From vines grown in the upper Douro Superior, this is crisp while also having ripe apple and apricot fruitiness. It is a lively wine, tangy with orange zest and a touch of spice. Drink now.

Portugal.Title: Secret Spot Wines 2016 Vale da Poupa Rosé (Douro)
Portugal.Description: This ripe, full-bodied rosé is made from 100% rich, perfumed Touriga Nacional. Good balance between ripe strawberry fruits and the crisp acidity make it both fruity and warm. Drink now.

Italy.Title: Vesevo 2016  Greco di Tufo
Italy.Description: Radiant and elegant, this offers enticing white stone fruit, Mediterranean brush and spring flower scents. The vibrant, balanced palate delivers creamy white peach, pear and tangy nectarine flavors, alongside crisp acidity. A savory mineral note gives it a mouthwatering finish.

Italy.Title: Di Meo 2016  Greco di Tufo
Italy.Description: Elegant, savory and balanced, this opens with delicate orchard fruit, Mediterranean scrub and wet stone scents. The vibrant, ethereal palate delivers lemon, nectarine and pear fruit, buttressed by crisp acidity. A savory mineral note gives it a mouthwatering finish.

Italy.Title: Feudo Montoni 2016 della Timpa Grillo (Sicilia)
Italy.Description: Spanish broom, yellow stone fruit and citrus zest aromas take shape in the glass. Lively acidity carries juicy nectarine, intense lemon, thyme, pineapple and Mediterranean herb flavors into the round, juicy finish.

Italy.Title: Orion Wines 2016 The Wanted Zin Blush Rosato (Puglia)
Italy.Description: Delicate scents of spring blossom and citrus carry over to the bright simple palate along with sour cherry. Zesty acidity gives it tangy finish.

Italy.Title: Villa Cordevigo 2016 Heaven Scent  (Bardolino Chiaretto)
Italy.Description: Subtly scented, this opens with aromas of citrus zest, spring flower and wild berry. It's fresh and informal, with light strawberry and sour-cherry flavors supported by fresh acidity.

Italy.Title: Botromagno 2016 Rosé di Lulu Rosato (Murgia)
Italy.Description: Made with Nero di Troia grapes, this has aromas of wild rose, citrus peel and a whiff of Mediterranean brush. The bright informal palate offers sour cherry and strawberry accompanied by zesty acidity.

Italy.Title: Tenuta Rapitalà 2016 Campo Reale Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)
Italy.Description: This early-drinking Nero d'Avola opens with ripe black-skinned fruit, tilled soil and cooking spice aromas. Straightforward and savory, it delivers black cherry, blackberry and ground pepper flavors alongside round tannins.

Italy.Title: Colosi 2016 Nero d'Avola (Terre Siciliane)
Italy.Description: Made entirely from Nero d'Avola, this opens with black-skinned berry, sun-baked earth and Mediterranean brush aromas. It's polished and savory on the palate and offers juicy black cherry, raspberry jam and white pepper notes alongside smooth tannins. It's made to be enjoyed young, so drink soon.

New Zealand.Title: Yealands 2016 Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Awatere Valley)
New Zealand.Description: A considerable step up in quality from the basic Yealands Sauvignon Blanc, this offering boasts attractive aromas of white grapefruit and pea tendrils. There's a silky texture and green, grassy elements on the palate, but they never stray too far into vegetal, finishing zesty and clean.

New Zealand.Title: Cottesbrook 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
New Zealand.Description: Fresh greens and white grapefruit aromas come together in this medium-bodied wine. A silky texture carries celery leaf and citrus flavors through the slightly bitter finish.

Chile.Title: Rubus 2016 Chardonnay (Colchagua Valley)
Chile.Description: Melon, wood spice and vanilla aromas are common for this level of Chilean Chardonnay. A plump palate is low on acidity, while this tastes of pear, oak and skins-based bitterness. A woody tasting finish is adequate.

Chile.Title: Santa Rita 2016 120 Reserva Especial Carmenère (Central Valley)
Chile.Description: Wiry currant and plum aromas show a touch of oak in this value-priced wine. It feels somewhat chunky on the palate, with scraping tannins. Herbal plum flavors finish gamy and with a mild note of oaky clove.

Chile.Title: Valdivieso 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)
Chile.Description: Briny saltwater aromas dominate a mild mostly fruitless nose. This feels basic and round, with a lemony streak. Mild nectarine flavors don't amount to much, while this is simple and generic on the finish.

Argentina.Title: Alta Vista 2016 Malbec Rosé (Mendoza)
Argentina.Description: Aromas of dish soap and fruit salad show on the nose while the palate brings pink grapefruit and orange. A citric finish with a peppery note lacks acidity, so drink now.

Argentina.Title: Domaine Bousquet 2016 Finca Lalande Malbec (Mendoza)
Argentina.Description: Racy plum and cherry aromas lead to an edgy palate with bold acidity. Crisp, foxy flavors of raspberry and plum finish spicy and with pronounced acidity. This wine emphasizes acidity and freshness over ripeness and heft.

Argentina.Title: Viña Cobos 2016 Felino Chardonnay (Mendoza)
Argentina.Description: Aromas of apple cider, peach and oak lead to a full palate. Flavors of melon and banana have a nutty quality, while this is stable on the finish, with tropical fruit and honeyed flavors. Drink now.

Argentina.Title: Lamadrid 2016 Single Vineyard Bonarda (Agrelo)
Argentina.Description: This Bonarda could be your everyday red or house pour with no issues. Solid berry aromas are fairly woody and a bit earthy. A bouncy, fresh palate is cheerful, while flavors of plum, blackberry, cassis and spices are toasty and forward-moving on the finish.

Spain.Title: Muga 2016 Flor de Muga Rosé (Rioja)
Spain.Description: If you are of the school that says rosé from Provence is the world's gold standard, then give this excellent newcomer a try. Brief skin contact has created a light color and sense of elegance on the nose and palate. Flavors of cantaloupe and peach are lightly sweet but cut by ample acidity. Drink as soon as possible to capture this wine's fresh essence.

Germany.Title: St. Christopher 2016 Piesporter Goldtröpfchen Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)
Germany.Description: Pristine peach, tangerine and blossom notes form the core of this fragrant fruity Riesling. Balanced in sweetness and reverberating with acidity, it's an exceptional value for such a juicy satisfying sip. Capture its youthful exuberance now through 2020.

Argentina.Title: Zolo 2017 Sustainably Farmed Estate Grown and Bottled Torrontés (Mendoza)
Argentina.Description: Tropical aromas of lychee and honeydew set up a straightforward palate. Powdery flavors of green melon and lychee are light and flowery on a modest finish.

Argentina.Title: Zolo 2017 Sustainably Farmed Estate Grown and Bottled Rosé (Mendoza)
Argentina.Description: This youthful pink-colored number smells of dusty cherry and Lifesavers. A juicy palate has a soda-like feel, while flavors of raspberry and cherry are light and dilute across the finish.
